title.rendered: Russian troops are under pressure as Ukraine advances.

content.rendered:
On Saturday, Western military experts and analysts expressed their belief that after Kyiv’s troops broke through the previous one and attempted to press their advances farther into the east, Russian forces established a new defensive position in Ukraine’s northeast. According to the British Defense Ministry’s daily intelligence briefing, the line is most likely between the Oskil River and Svatove, 150 kilometers southeast of Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second-largest city.

The new line was established after a Ukrainian counteroffensive breached the previous front line in the conflict and retook huge tracts of territory in the northeastern Kharkiv region bordering Russia.

As one of the few significant logistical supply routes that originate in the Russian territory of Belgorod, Moscow “definitely views preserving control of this zone as crucial,” the British military added that they expected “a strong defense of this area.” It remained uncertain, meanwhile, if the Russians would indeed be able to fend off another planned Ukrainian assault.
